landing.heroDesc: Visualize and securely manage API keys, environment variables, and registration IDs for your project's external services.
landing.featuresDesc: Everything you need for project setup, all in one place
landing.howDesc: Complete your project setup in 4 simple steps
landing.pricingDesc: Start free, upgrade when you need
landing.finalCtaDesc: Manage up to 3 projects for free. No credit card required.
landing.heroSubtitle: From GitHub to databases, visualize complex service connections at a glance. Automatically generate real-time infrastructure maps your entire team can understand.
landing.demoSectionTitle: From Simple Blogs to Complex SaaS
landing.demoSectionDesc: Compare service connection structures by project scale, and monitor connection status on a dashboard.
landing.featureMapDesc: Visualize your project's service architecture as an interactive diagram. Share easily with teammates and grasp dependencies at a glance.
landing.featureChecklistDesc: Step-by-step guides for each service make it easy for beginners to connect.
landing.featureTemplateDesc: Start quickly with proven templates for SaaS, AI apps, and more.
landing.featureEnvDesc: Securely store API keys and secrets with AES-256 encryption, and download .env files in one click.
landing.step1Desc: Create a new project or start from a template. 5 templates including SaaS, AI apps, and more.
landing.step2Desc: Choose from 20+ services in the catalog and follow the step-by-step checklist.
landing.step3Desc: Store API keys securely and download .env files in one click.
landing.dashboardDesc: Monitor all service connections at a glance
landing.step4Desc: AI analyzes your architecture, diagnoses missing configurations, and recommends the optimal stack.
landing.aiSectionDesc: 5 AI features automate everything from project setup to operations
landing.aiFeature1Desc: Describe your project and AI recommends the optimal service stack. Analyzes cost, complexity, and layers.
landing.aiFeature2Desc: Automatically diagnoses missing variables, security risks, and naming convention violations with fix suggestions.
landing.aiFeature3Desc: AI explains complex architectures in natural language. Streams insights on dependencies, bottlenecks, and improvements.
landing.aiFeature4Desc: Supabase vs Firebase? AI compares pricing, features, and scalability with data-driven analysis.
landing.aiFeature5Desc: Say "Add Stripe" and AI automatically adds services and configures connections for you.
landing.deployDesc: One GitHub OAuth and your homepage goes live in 3 minutes
landing.deployStep1Desc: Securely connect your GitHub account via OAuth
landing.deployStep2Desc: Pick from 6 templates: portfolio, blog, and more
landing.deployStep3Desc: GitHub Actions auto-builds and deploys your site
landing.deployStep4Desc: Instantly available on your github.io domain
landing.testimonialDesc: Real reviews from developers using Linkmap
landing.testimonial1Quote: Managing environment variables became so much easier. We used to share .env files manually â€” now Linkmap keeps everything secure in one place.
landing.testimonial2Quote: Service map visualization is the best. We can grasp our complex microservice architecture at a glance â€” onboarding time was cut in half.
landing.testimonial3Quote: The AI Env Doctor catches missing configs automatically, which drastically reduced our deployment failures. Team productivity is way up.
landing.footerTagline: The hub connecting the start and end of vibe coding

cloudflareGuide.heroDesc: Step-by-step guide for account setup, build commands, and environment variables (secrets) when deploying Linkmap to Cloudflare Workers.
cloudflareGuide.overviewDesc: To run the Next.js app on Cloudflare Workers, use the OpenNext Cloudflare adapter. Follow the steps below.
cloudflareGuide.overviewItem1: Set up Cloudflare account and workers.dev subdomain
cloudflareGuide.overviewItem2: Log in with wrangler locally, then build and deploy
cloudflareGuide.overviewItem3: Register required env vars as secrets
cloudflareGuide.accountStep1: Sign up or log in at https://dash.cloudflare.com
cloudflareGuide.accountStep2: Go to Workers & Pages in the left menu
cloudflareGuide.accountStep3a: On Workers & Pages, click 'Your subdomain' or 'Change'
cloudflareGuide.accountStep3b: Enter a name (e.g. linkmap) and save â†’ *.workers.dev URL will be available
cloudflareGuide.accountWarning: Without a subdomain, Git-connected deployments may return 404 or 'An unknown error'.
cloudflareGuide.buildDesc: Run the Cloudflare build locally, then deploy.
cloudflareGuide.buildNote: After deploy you get a URL like https://<name>.<subdomain>.workers.dev. You can set env vars in the next step.
cloudflareGuide.envDesc: Move values from Vercel or .env.local into Cloudflare secrets. Enter one at a time.
cloudflareGuide.envSource: Copy values from your Vercel project settings or .env.local.
cloudflareGuide.gitDesc: When connecting a GitHub repo in the Cloudflare dashboard, you must change the build command.
cloudflareGuide.gitWhy: npm run build only produces .next/. Wrangler expects .open-next/, which is created by npm run build:cf.
cloudflareGuide.gitCommitFiles: These files must be committed before deploy:
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsDesc: The repo includes a deploy workflow. Set GitHub Secrets and every push to main will auto-deploy.
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsStep1: Repo â†’ Settings â†’ Secrets and variables â†’ Actions
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsStep2: Add the 4 secrets below (New repository secret)
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsStep3: Push to main or run 'Deploy to Cloudflare Workers' manually in the Actions tab
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsSecretAccount: Cloudflare account ID (from dashboard URL or Overview)
cloudflareGuide.gitActionsWorkflow: Workflow: .github/workflows/deploy-cloudflare.yml (build: npm run build:cf, deploy: npx wrangler deploy)
cloudflareGuide.summaryDoc: See docs/cloudflare-migration.md for full migration steps
cloudflareGuide.congratsDesc: You've completed the Cloudflare setup guide. Pushing to main will auto-deploy.

deployProgress.doNotClose: Don't close this page â€” deployment is in progress
deployProgress.preparingDesc: Verifying your GitHub account and template
deployProgress.repoDesc: Copying the template repository to your GitHub. Bringing over file structure and configuration.
deployProgress.pagesDesc: Activating GitHub Pages and configuring build settings. The first build is starting.
deployProgress.liveDesc: Build complete! Your site is being deployed to a global CDN.
deployProgress.tip1: GitHub Pages hosts static sites completely free
deployProgress.tip2: After deploy, you can freely edit the code in your GitHub repo
deployProgress.tip3: You can connect a custom domain later
deployProgress.tip4: Once deployed, manage your site from the Linkmap dashboard
deployProgress.tip5: GitHub Actions automatically handles builds and deploys
